unit_learning_outcomes.description: Synthesise scholarly knowledge of research and apply this knowledge to how students learn mathematical concepts.
Skilfully communicate knowledge of mathematical content and teaching strategies with scholarship making use of supporting evidence.
Plan for, implement and critically reflect on effective units of work in mathematics that provide achievable challenges for students of varying backgrounds and abilities.
Critically analyse a range of teaching strategies related to the content of Stages 4 and 5 of the mathematics syllabus.
Explore and apply educational ideas through action research.
Demonstrate in-depth, broad and coherent knowledge of the content of Stages 4 and 5 mathematics of the NSW 7-10 syllabus for the Australian Curriculum.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Readings and other asynchronous online activities related to the fortnightly online tutorials and workshops which students complete individually and discuss in iLearn Discussion Forums

assessments.description: Conduct an interview with a secondary school student about their understanding of equations; report the results and suggest implications for learning and teaching mathematics [1500 words]
Prepare a unit of work for a topic from the Stages 4-5 mathematics syllabus [2000 words]

data.subject_search_title: EDST8226 - Teaching Mathematics in the Secondary School 1
data.description: This unit provides an introduction to the secondary mathematics curriculum and its teaching. Students develop and integrate an in-depth, broad and coherent knowledge of the central concepts of school algebra; teaching methods, including planning units of work and the role of technology in mathematics education; and a critical reflection on practical and professional issues arising from students' professional experience. Particular emphasis is given to learning and teaching mathematics in Years 7 to 10.
